messages.content:
You are a customer service expert system.
You are tasked with determining if an incoming call is a repeat call.
A repeat call is defined as a call that is about the same issue as one or more previous calls that occurred within the last month.
The user will provide you with details on the customer, the current call event, and a list of previous call events from within the relevant time frame.
Each call event contains a self-described callreason, which is a one sentence description by the customer of the issue they are calling that they gave the automated routing system before being connected to a customer service agent.
In addition to that, the historic call events will also contain a call summary, which is a summary generated automatically after that call event was completed.

Use the following criteria to determine if the issue of the current call is the same as the issue of a previous call:
 - You believe it is likely that the current call is about the same product as the previous call. It can be the case that the customer refers to the product by (part of) the product name, or a more general term (like 'lawnmower' instead of 'AutoMow 3000'), or by a description of the product.
 - If it is clearly a different product, it is not a repeat call.
 - You have reason to suspect that the issue with that product is related to the issue of the previous call. This can be the case if the customer refers to the same issue in a different way, or if the customer describes a different issue that is likely related to the previous issue.
 - If it is clearly a different issue, it is not a repeat call.

Please reason about your task and return your answer in the requested format.

## Customer Information
ID: 7
Name: Porter Osborne
Customer Lifetime Value: High
Customer Since: 2023-09-16

## Current Call Details
Call Description: My self-driving mower isn't working since this morning
Timestamp: 2024-01-10 10:05:22


## Previous Call History

### Call on 2024-01-09 09:15:03
Description: My AutoMow 3000 stops working
Summary:  "Customer reported that her AutoMow 3000 suddenly stopped operating. Agent walked her through a power-cycle and checked the onboard error log (connectivity fault). A ticket was opened and the customer was assured the issue would be resolved by 2024-01-10."
Duration: 11.1 minutes
Start: 2024-01-09 09:15:03
End: 2024-01-09 09:26:11
Time since this call: 1 days and 0.7 hours


Based on this information, is the current call a repeated call about the same issue? Please analyze the timing between calls, similarity of issues discussed, and provide your reasoning.

{"customer_id":7,"analysis":"The current call is about a self-driving mower not working, which is likely referring to the same product as the previous call, the AutoMow 3000. The previous call involved the AutoMow 3000 suddenly stopping operation, which indicates a malfunction similar to the current issue of the mower not working. Both calls are related to operational issues with the same product, suggesting that the current call is indeed a follow-up on the previous issue. The timing is also relevant, as the previous call was just one day prior, indicating that the customer is still experiencing problems with the same product.","conclusion":"The call is a repeated call.","is_repeated_call":true}

## Customer Information
ID: 22
Name: Andrew Lyons
Customer Lifetime Value: High
Customer Since: 2024-04-03

## Current Call Details
Call Description: My HedgeBot Compact won't turn on.
Timestamp: 2025-02-15 10:12:10


## Previous Call History

### Call on 2025-02-13 14:03:01
Description: Was asking about the expired Aquaspray X promotion.
Summary: Customer inquired about a recently expired promotional offer on the Aquaspray X robotic washer. Explained that the promotion had ended and recommended joining the mailing list to receive notifications on future deals. Customer accepted the suggestion. No further issues were reported. Resolution was expected immediately as no follow-up action was required.
Duration: 11.7 minutes
Start: 2025-02-13 14:03:01
End: 2025-02-13 14:14:44
Time since this call: 1 days and 20.0 hours


Based on this information, is the current call a repeated call about the same issue? Please analyze the timing between calls, similarity of issues discussed, and provide your reasoning.

{"customer_id":22,"analysis":"The current call is about a HedgeBot Compact that won't turn on. The previous call was about an expired promotion for the Aquaspray X robotic washer. These two issues are clearly related to different products (HedgeBot Compact vs. Aquaspray X) and different types of issues (product malfunction vs. promotional inquiry). Therefore, there is no overlap in product or issue, indicating that this is not a repeat call.","conclusion":"The call is not a repeated call.","is_repeated_call":false}

## Customer Information
ID: 37
Name: Saul Brandt
Customer Lifetime Value: Low
Customer Since: 2024-04-16

## Current Call Details
Call Description: My AutoMow Mini still keeps turning off while mowing.
Timestamp: 2024-10-15 09:45:31


## Previous Call History

### Call on 2024-10-12 15:20:00
Description: Still having the same AutoMow Mini shutdown issue.
Summary: Customer expressed growing frustration as the mower continued shutting off. Noted that issue is now clearly persistent. Escalation initiated to product support team. Promised an update within 3 working days.
Duration: 15.0 minutes
Start: 2024-10-12 15:20:00
End: 2024-10-12 15:35:00
Time since this call: 2 days and 18.2 hours

### Call on 2024-10-10 11:05:00
Description: AutoMow Mini shut down again mid-use.
Summary: Customer followed up to say the mower shut off again. We began a basic diagnostics process but did not escalate yet. Informed customer to keep device running under observation. Estimated resolution by early next week.
Duration: 12.0 minutes
Start: 2024-10-10 11:05:00
End: 2024-10-10 11:17:00
Time since this call: 4 days and 22.5 hours

### Call on 2024-09-24 10:30:00
Description: AutoMow Mini shuts down randomly while mowing.
Summary: Customer reported that the AutoMow Mini had powered off mid-mow for the first time. Initially assumed to be user error or a one-off fault. Customer was asked to observe further and report back if issue persists. Promised resolution if problem reoccurred within the week.
Duration: 12.0 minutes
Start: 2024-09-24 10:30:00
End: 2024-09-24 10:42:00
Time since this call: 20 days and 23.1 hours


Based on this information, is the current call a repeated call about the same issue? Please analyze the timing between calls, similarity of issues discussed, and provide your reasoning.

{"customer_id":37,"analysis":"The current call is about the AutoMow Mini shutting off while mowing, which is the same product as discussed in previous calls. The previous calls also reported similar issues with the AutoMow Mini shutting down, indicating a persistent problem. The customer has called about this issue multiple times in the last month, specifically on 2024-10-10 and 2024-10-12, both of which were about the same shutdown issue. Therefore, the current call is a continuation of the same issue that has been reported previously.","conclusion":"The call is a repeated call.","is_repeated_call":true}
